title: Livestream: Ms. G, Massachusetts’ official groundhog, to make annual prediction
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Ms. G, Massachusetts' official groundhog, will predict the arrival of spring at Drumlin Farm Wildlife Sanctuary in Lincoln.
The annual event is scheduled for February 2, 2026, with Ms. G taking the stage at 10 a.m.
Mass Audubon hosts the event where Ms. G predicts early spring or six more weeks of winter.

title: Massachusetts keeps losing residents to other states, Census finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts experienced a net outflow exceeding 30,000 residents last year, mainly to states like Florida and New Hampshire.
Experts warn this migration trend impacts the state's workforce, economic strength, and ability to attract business investment.
Massachusetts still sees population growth through international immigration, but the rate has slowed since previous years.

title: Photos: Day 2 at Something in the Way fest at Roadrunner
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Day 2 at Something in the Way fest featured 12 bands at Roadrunner in Brighton.
Headlining act Sunny Day Real Estate closed out the festival's Sunday performances.
Photography from Day 2 was captured by Ben Stas for Boston.com.

title: For Bourne, the new Sagamore Bridge takings echo a long past
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts will demolish 13 homes in Bourne for the new Sagamore Bridge starting construction in 2028.
Residents recall past eminent domain actions, including land taken for the Cape Cod Canal and Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
A tight housing market concerns families facing relocation, with appeals underway against state compensation offers.

title: ‘It’s a joke’: David Pastrnak, Bruins vent after controversial OT call in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Pastrnak's overtime goal was disallowed, and he received a penalty for slashing in a controversial call against Tampa Bay.
The Boston Bruins blew a 5-1 lead, allowing Tampa Bay to score three power-play goals and win 6-5 in a shootout.
Bruins players criticized the officiating, noting a lack of penalty calls against Tampa and Pastrnak's penalty confusion.

title: 11 takeaways from Bruins’ wild shootout loss to Lightning in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins lost 6-5 to the Lightning in a shootout during the Stadium Series at Raymond James Stadium.
Boston led 5-1 but Tampa Bay scored three power-play goals to tie, then won in the shootout.
The game featured a rare goalie fight between Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy under colder-than-expected conditions.

title: Former dairy farm in Dartmouth converted to $2M luxury home
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A former Gulf Hill Dairy Farm barn in Dartmouth was converted into a $2M, 7,891-square-foot luxury home.
The renovation kept the architectural style, including a large stone fireplace and exposed beams, complete by 2017.
The home features four bedrooms, six baths, a 12-car garage, and modern amenities like solar panels and smart controls.

title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston Police Officer Scott MacIsaac died from cancer on Friday after serving in the department for over 30 years.
MacIsaac joined BPD in 1995 and worked in several districts, most recently in West Roxbury for six years.
During his career, MacIsaac received commendations for lifesaving efforts and actions during the Boston Marathon bombings.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jeremy Swayman and Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a goalie fight during Sunday's outdoor NHL game.
Both goalies received five-minute major penalties for fighting and two-minute penalties for leaving the crease.
Swayman ended the game with 41 saves despite the Bruins' 6-5 shootout loss to Tampa Bay.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with two counts of murder for shooting Nicholas and Elizabeth Almeida in Fall River.
The shootings occurred on Barnes Street, Friday night, where the victims were found with gunshot wounds.
Cole, in a relationship with Elizabeth Almeida, faces arraignment for murder and unlawful firearm possession.
